captions.text:
>>FIRST OF ALL, MATT, WE WANT YOU TO KNOW
THAT
WE ARE ALL YOUR FRIENDS HERE.
>>NO MATT. WE FOUND THIS IN YOUR CAR.

>>SO, YOU'RE NOT EVEN GOING TO PRETEND IT'S
NOT YOURS?
>>I ASSUMED THAT WHEN YOU SAID YOU OPENED IT.
>>HOW LONG HAS THIS BEEN GOING ON?
GUYS DIDN'T KNOW THIS, BUT I HAVE DIABETES.
>>MATT, WE CAN'T HAVE A SERIOUS CONVERSATION IF YOU'RE JUST
YOU'RE AT SOME PARTY AND THE GUYS ARE
AND YOU JUST CAN'T SAY NO.
>>WE'RE GOING TO HELP YOU GET THROUGH THIS MATT.
>>I KNOW IT FEELS THAT WAY NOW, BUT YOU DON'T NEED
I JUST NEED IT TO LIVE.
>>THERE ARE OTHER WAYS TO FEEL ALIVE!
YOU CAN GET A NATURAL HIGHS.
HERE, HAVE THIS GIANT PIXIE STICK.
DO YOU NOT UNDERSTAND HOW DIABETES WORKS?

I NEED INSULIN TO REGULATE MY BLOOD SUGAR
LEVEL.
LIKE RIGHT NOW, I HAD A LOT OF CARBS AT LUNCH,
SO I NEED TO TAKE SOME INSULIN TO BREAK DOWN THE
SUGARS OTHERWISE BAD THINGS WILL START TO HAPPEN TO ME.
>>LOOK MATT. I KNOW THAT YOU'RE PROBABLY
BUT YOU'RE GOING TO QUIT RIGHT NOW.
I'M GOING TO GO INTO KETOACIDOSIS.
WE'RE GOING TO STAY RIGHT HERE TO MAKE SURE YOU
>>SO THAT'S WHAT THEY'RE CALLING THEM THESE DAYS.
>>LOOK, IN A VERY REMOVED WAY I AM
BUT, IN A MORE IMPORTANT AND LIFE THREATENING WAY,
I AM VERY UPSET WITH YOU GUYS.
YOU'RE COMPLETELY IGNORANT ABOUT A VERY PREVALENT DISEASE.
>>WAIT, WHO ARE YOU TRYING TO CALL?

ARE YOU TRYING TO SCORE SOME INSULIN FROM
YOUR PHARMACIST?
BECAUSE I'M GOING TO NEED ONE SOON.
THE PANCREAS IS A USELESS ORGAN.

>>NO, THE APPENDIX IS THE THING AT THE BACK
OF TEXTBOOKS.
>>OKAY LISTEN, WE UNDERSTAND THAT YOU'RE ANGRY,
BUT WE LOVE YOU TOO MUCH TO LET YOU DO THIS!
FRIENDS DON'T LET FRIENDS TAKE INSULIN.
I NEED PARAMEDICS TO COME WITH AN INSULIN SHOT BECAUSE MY
WELL-MEANING FRIENDS DIDN'T KNOW I HAVE DIABETES AND THEY FLUSHED
>>SIR, WE CAN'T HELP YOU IF YOU'RE GOING TO MAKE UP WORDS.
DID YOU LEARN SOMETHING ABOUT DIABETES FROM THAT SKETCH?
IF YOU ANSWERED "NO," YOU NEED TO WATCH THIS THING AGAIN.
GO ON. GIT. YOU THOUGHT YOU WERE JUST HERE TO LAUGH.

comments.author: arbiter11171

comments.text:
I have been Type one for 15 years, and this was hilarious. Many people are 
ignorant about this disease, and it is great to see it represented without 
a focus on obesity. I have never had friends try to flush my medicine 
before, but I have had them accuse me of being a drug addict. I really love 
this video. It is definitely about awareness, and is not offensive to me at 
all. The only people being made fun of are the people who don't understand 
diabetes. ﻿

comments.author: Madelin Madamba

comments.text:
This wasn't offensive, it was tastefully mocking the ignorance that some 
people display towards a disease.
comments.author: Alex Cobb

comments.text:
Had this linked to me by a friend with T1D. I was like "omg flushed his 
insulin?!?! NOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!". Great video to address outrageous 
reactions people have who do not understand diabetes in general, never mind 
the differences between T2 and T1.

PS: There's no freaking cure. No "okra diet", no "omg click this link to 
cure diabetes in 12 days". Cause if there *WAS*, people wouldn't have 
diabetes. I'd be stuffing my face with that cure so fast... imagine how 
someone WITH diabetes feels having to stab themselves repeatedly and 
dealing with the ignorance. Bet your maple syrup butt they'd jump on a 
proven cure.

Speaking of maple syrup, enjoy responsibly and nom on, diabetics. You know 
what you need to do to have a healthy lifestyle. You're in control and I 
<3's you all :)﻿
comments.author: Michael Belanger

comments.text:

have to say that this is probably my favorite!﻿

comments.text: mallory! it's not "appendix"! it's INDEX!﻿
comments.author: Rebecca Greaves

comments.text:
There are both in some text books.  For instance an appendix may have 
grammar rules or lists of important information depending on the text book 
while the index tells you where to find words or ideas in the textbook.
